page.title: 01Staxton Area
page.content: North of the block is flat farmland of the Derwent floodplain. mainly grassland for stock grazing and some other crops. The A64 runs across the block and nearby there are three villages, mainly residential with some farms. Further south is the steep Staxton Brow, the north edge of te wolds when the chalklands rise to an area of arable farms with plantations on the steeper slopes. The south is all hilly arable farmland and some grazing. There are a few farms but most residnts live near the main roads in the north and presumably work outside the block, which is close to Scarborough. There is some caravan site developemnt as the area is quite convenient for tourists to reach coastal and National park locations. The coutnryside in the south is quite attractive and much visited
